title: devboard
description: DevBoard is a full-stack web application built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and Material UI (MUI) to serve as a personal project management and dashboard tool. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and management, providing a structured and organized approach to tracking and visualizing development progress, while showcasing best practices in modern TypeScript and React development.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: The Sleep Debt Tracker is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML that helps users visualize and manage their sleep debt. This project allows users to log their sleep hours, calculate their sleep debt over time, and track their progress towards achieving optimal sleep patterns, making it a useful tool for improving sleep hygiene.

title: next-voting
description: Next-Voting is a project showcasing a decentralized voting system built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. This repository implements a secure and transparent platform for creating and participating in various voting events, focusing on accessibility and user-friendly design while exploring modern web development practices.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project that implements a fully functional and customizable event calendar. Built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, this repository provides a responsive and interactive way to display and manage events, allowing users to easily visualize scheduled activities and potentially integrate with external data sources for dynamic event loading. The project demonstrates practical application of web development principles for calendar functionality.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository hosts a modern IoT asset tracking web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase. It provides a project template for visualizing and managing the real-time location and status of physical assets, leveraging database functionalities for data storage and user authentication. The project showcases best practices for building scalable and maintainable web apps with a focus on real-time data and a responsive user interface.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard is a web-based interface built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS to visualize and interact with data from the Robofleet robotics platform. This project provides a user-friendly dashboard for monitoring robot status, tracking tasks, and potentially controlling robot operations, offering a comprehensive view of the robotic system's performance and activity. It's focused on providing a practical and intuitive project for managing and understanding robotic deployments.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next Idea Board is a collaborative project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that allows users to brainstorm, organize, and prioritize ideas using a visual board interface. This project focuses on providing a simple and intuitive platform for teams or individuals to manage and develop their innovative concepts.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built with Jupyter Notebook and Python, contains a collection of finance-related projects aimed at applying Python programming to solve real-world financial problems. It explores various topics in finance, providing practical examples and code implementations for financial analysis, modeling, and data visualization, making it a valuable resource for anyone looking to learn finance with Python.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, this project provides an intuitive interface to parse, filter, and display ROS log data, enabling developers to efficiently debug and understand their robotic system's behavior.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This repository hosts a project focused on creating interactive map visualizations using HTML for the front-end interface and Python for data processing and backend functionality. It demonstrates techniques for visualizing geographic data and building dynamic web maps, aligning with topics in data visualization and interactive web development.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built using Python, Flask, PostgreSQL, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting. This project showcases the implementation of Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations within a web-based environment, providing a practical example of integrating backend logic with a user-friendly interface for efficient data management.

title: atg-world
description: atg-world is a web project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. This repository contains the code for [briefly describe project purpose based on readme/knowledge, e.g., "a personal portfolio website," or "a web application for visualizing global data," or "a dynamic single-page application"]. The project focuses on [mention the key topic/goal of the project, e.g., "showcasing web development skills," or "providing an interactive data exploration experience," or "demonstrating modern front-end architecture"].

title: resume
description: This repository hosts my resume project, built using TeX for generating a professional-looking PDF and optionally rendered as an HTML page for online viewing. It serves as a central location for managing my resume source files and showcases my skills and experience in a structured and presentable manner.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project showcasing a modern dashboard built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It aims to provide a responsive and feature-rich user interface for data visualization and management, demonstrating best practices in front-end development with a focus on utilizing the power of Next.js for server-side rendering and optimal performance.

It leverages modern web development practices and aims to [Mention a key benefit or intended outcome, e.g., provide a user-friendly interface, offer enhanced performance, etc.]. title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, Vite.js, and Express.js to leverage the Gemini API for engaging conversations and interactive project experiences. It utilizes HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for a dynamic front-end and explores the capabilities of the Gemini API through a well-structured TypeScript backend, offering users a platform to interact with AI-powered conversational features.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-Seller is a full-stack e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (pages router), TypeScript, and React, leveraging MUI for a responsive and user-friendly interface. This repository showcases modern web development practices using React Query for efficient data fetching and management, along with robust type safety provided by TypeScript, demonstrating a complete online fruit store implementation.
